name: Idiopathic Laryngeal Neuropathic Syndrome (ILNS)
chief_complaint: Persistent throat pain and voice changes with no obvious cause
physical_findings: Intermittent vocal cord adduction during phonation

lab_results.Laryngeal EMG: Increased spontaneous activity in thyroarytenoid muscle

treatment: Voice therapy with laryngeal relaxation techniques
prognosis: Variable; 60% achieve significant symptom reduction with multimodal therapy, but may require long-term management
description: A rare neuropathic disorder affecting the superior laryngeal nerve branches, characterized by chronic neuropathic throat pain without structural abnormalities. Thought to involve peripheral and central sensitization of laryngeal nerves. Often misdiagnosed as GERD or functional voice disorders.
risk_factors: History of viral upper respiratory infection (preceding onset)
Vocal overuse prior to symptom onset
